controller

Interface Draw

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Controller

    public interface Draw
    This interface groups together all the methods used to draw components on the window. Actors are drawn as stickmen, objects as rectangles, invocation messages as full lines, and result messages as striped lines. Parties in the communication diagram are painted wherever the user clicked, but in the sequence diagram they are all placed at the same height, next to each other, with a lifeline running underneath. Messages are drawn from party to party in the communication diagram, and from lifeline to lifeline in the sequence diagram.
    Author:
    groep 03

    • Method Detail

      • drawActor

        default void drawActor(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                       double x,
                       double y,
                       int size,
                       Party actor)
        This method paints an actor on the window
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics library used
        x - The x coordinate to start painting from
        y - The y coordinate to start painting from
        size - The size of the painted stickfigure
        actor - The actor that will be displayed as a stickfigure
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal actor, coordinates or size

      • drawObject

        default void drawObject(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                        double x,
                        double y,
                        int height,
                        int width,
                        Party object)
        This method paints an object on the window
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics library used
        x - The x coordinate to start painting from
        y - The y coordinate to start painting from
        height - The height of the rectangle to paint
        width - The width of the rectangle to paint
        object - The object that will be displayed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal object, coordinates or size

      • drawLifeline

        default void drawLifeline(java.awt.Graphics g,
                          int x,
                          int startY,
                          int endY)
        This method draws a lifeline underneath parties in the sequence diagram
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics library used
        x - The x coordinate of the party
        startY - The start y value for the lifeline
        endY - The end y value for the lifeline
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal coordinates or size

      • drawParty

        default void drawParty(java.awt.Graphics g,
                       Party party)
        This method paints a party on the sequence diagram window. It draws and actor or object, with a lifeline underneath
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics library used
        party - The party to paint on the window
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal party

        default void drawResultMessage(java.awt.Graphics2D g,
                               boolean focused,
                               double xSender,
                               double ySender,
                               double xReceiver,
                               double yReceiver)
        This method draws a result message on the window
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics library used
        focused - Boolean that signifies is the message is focused or not
        xSender - The x coordinate of the message sender
        ySender - The y coordinate of the message sender
        xReceiver - The x coordinate of the message receiver
        yReceiver - The y coordinate of the message receiver
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal party coordinates

      • getLineWidthResult

        default int getLineWidthResult(boolean focused)
        This method determines how wide the line for a result message should be
        Parameters:
        focused - Boolean that signifies is the message is focused or not
        Returns:
        The number of pixels the line width should be

      • setColor

        default void setColor(Focusable focusable,
                      java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        This method sets the color for all components. Focused components will be blue, others black.
        Parameters:
        focusable - The component to be painted
        g - The graphics library used
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Illegal party
